title: cmd/gc: memory exhausted; <unknown line number>: mark left on the stack
body:
I know the code is a bit contrived, but I was encouraged to report this anyway. Not sure
how often something like this would come up in practice.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
http://play.golang.org/p/zPMdG-kJ4b

If you remove one of the exclamation marks the code compiles and runs without problem.

What is the expected output?
Either a functioning program or a more instructive error message.

What do you see instead?
prog.go:3: imported and not used: "fmt"
prog.go:6: memory exhausted
<unknown line number>: mark left on the stack

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g 

Which operating system are you using?
Centos 6.1

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.1 linux/amd64
